item.title: Report E-2025040606
item.description:
Report E-2025040606

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T01:00:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-28
  • City: LAMONI
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOLE TRANSPORT LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver overfilled in ground diesel fuel tank at Kum and Go gas station while making a fuel delivery. Underground tank had the flapper device shut due to the tank volume reaching the overfill protection. Driver unhooked the hose full of diesel fuel spilling the contents on the ground around the tank. Roughly 4 gallons impacted concrete only and the Solar Driver was able to use his spill kit to clean up the effected area no further clean up was required. Iowa DNR was called but Dispatch was told it didn't meet the trigger Qty for a report.

item.title: Report E-2025040537
item.description:
Report E-2025040537

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-26
  • City: ALTOONA
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately three (3) cups of material released from one (1) box due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the box being damaged. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel swept the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 3-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025040545
item.description:
Report E-2025040545

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-25
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 09:56 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release at terminal XDM. It was reported that approximately 2 cups of VM&P Naphtha released from one 55-gallon metal drum due to improper packaging. The release impacted trailer #3193050. Call Center reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Waste labels 231649-1 and 231649-2 were created, one 65-gallon metal drum containing one 55-gallon metal drum and one 55-gallon metal drum containing one broken down wooden pallet. CHEMTREC was notified of the release, report #2025032500101 was given by Charles.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) ounce of material released from one (1) 2-gallon metal pail due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pail leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel containerized the damaged pail and the product still in it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s

item.title: Report E-2025040117
item.description:
Report E-2025040117

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-09
  • City: RUTLAND
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PRO COOPERATIVE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At or about 2045 hrs on 9 July 2024 a hydrostatic valve failed on a nurse tank owned by Pro Cooperative in the town of Rutland Iowa causing the release of 70 gallons of Anhydrous Ammonia into the atmosphere (360.5 Lbs, RQ of 100 Lbs). The Humboldt County Sherrif and Emergency Coordinator were called and the HAZMAT team was dispatched at or about 2050 hrs, 9 July, 2024. The HAZMAT Team closed the valve, the Sherriff Department cordoned the area and restricted access while evacuating some residents and advising all others to shelter in place until the vapor dissipated.
